data.name: pysersic
data.description: Bayesian fitting of Sersic profiles to galaxy images accelerated with jax

evidence: README install command: "```pysersic``` now requies at least python version 3.9. To start you should have ```jax``` installed. The easiest way to do this is to use ``` pip install 'jax[cpu]' ```, however if you are on windows"
"pysersic is a code for fitting sersic profiles to galaxy images using Bayesian Inference. It is written in python using jax with inference performed using numpyro."
Usage examples show it imported as a library: "from pysersic.priors import SourceProperties" and "from pysersic import FitSingle".
